transcripts.text: You ready for this?  Yeah.  In 1976, Richard Dawkins proposed an idea in his book.  What if ideas were like organisms, where they could breed and mutate?  But unlike cells, ideas do not rely on a chemical basis for survival.  They begin from a single location and spread outward, jumping from one vessel to another, battling for attention.
